ğŸ§¹ AgentCore End-to-End Cleanup

This notebook provides a comprehensive cleanup process for all resources created during the AgentCore End-to-End tutorial.

Overview

This cleanup process will remove: - Memory: AgentCore Memory resources and stored data - Runtime: Agent runtime instances and ECR repositories - Security: Execution roles, and Authorization Provider resources - Observability: CloudWatch log groups and streams - Local Files: Generated configuration and code files

âš ï¸ Important: This cleanup is irreversible. Make sure you have saved any important data (if needed) before proceeding.

Step 1: Import Required Dependencies

Load all necessary modules and helper functions for the cleanup process.

import boto3
import os
from botocore.exceptions import ClientError

from bedrock_agentcore_starter_toolkit import Runtime
from lab_helpers.lab2_memory import delete_memory, REGION
from lab_helpers.utils import (
    delete_agentcore_runtime_execution_role,
    delete_ssm_parameter,
    cleanup_cognito_resources,
    get_customer_support_secret,
    delete_customer_support_secret,
    agentcore_memory_cleanup,
    gateway_target_cleanup,
    runtime_resource_cleanup,
    delete_observability_resources,
    local_file_cleanup
)

print("âœ… Dependencies imported successfully")
print(f"ğŸŒ Working in region: {REGION}")

Step 2: Clean Up Memory Resources

Remove AgentCore Memory resources and associated data.

print("ğŸ§  Starting Memory cleanup...")
agentcore_memory_cleanup()

Step 3: Clean Up Runtime Resources

Remove the AgentCore Runtime, ECR repository, and associated AWS resources.

print("ğŸš€ Starting Runtime cleanup...")
runtime_resource_cleanup()

Step 4: Clean Up Gateway Resources

Remove targets, Gateway

print("âš™ï¸ Starting Gateway Cleanup...")
gateway_target_cleanup()

Step 5: Clean Up Security Resources

Remove execution roles, and authentication resources.

print("ğŸ›¡ï¸  Starting Security cleanup...")
import json
try:
    # bedrock_client = boto3.client("bedrock", region_name=REGION)
    
    # Delete execution role
    print("  ğŸ—‘ï¸  Deleting AgentCore Runtime execution role...")
    delete_agentcore_runtime_execution_role()
    print("  âœ… Execution role deleted")
    
    # Delete SSM parameter
    print("  ğŸ—‘ï¸  Deleting SSM parameter...")
    delete_ssm_parameter("/app/customersupport/agentcore/runtime_arn")
    print("  âœ… SSM parameter deleted")
    
    # Clean up Cognito and secrets
    print("  ğŸ—‘ï¸  Cleaning up Cognito resources...")
    cs = json.loads(get_customer_support_secret())
    cleanup_cognito_resources(cs['pool_id'])
    print("  âœ… Cognito resources cleaned up")
    
    print("  ğŸ—‘ï¸  Deleting customer support secret...")
    delete_customer_support_secret()
    print("  âœ… Customer support secret deleted")
    
except Exception as e:
    print(f"  âš ï¸  Error during security cleanup: {e}")

Step 6: Clean Up Local Files

Remove generated configuration and code files from the local directory.

print("ğŸ“ Starting Local Files cleanup...")
local_file_cleanup()

Step 7: Clean Up Observability Resources

Remove CloudWatch log groups and streams used for agent monitoring.

print("ğŸ“Š Starting Observability cleanup...")

delete_observability_resources()

ğŸ‰ Cleanup Complete!

All AgentCore resources have been cleaned up. Hereâ€™s a summary of what was removed:

print("\n" + "=" * 60)
print("ğŸ§¹ CLEANUP COMPLETED SUCCESSFULLY! ğŸ§¹")
print("=" * 60)
print()
print("ğŸ“‹ Resources cleaned up:")
print("  ğŸ§  Memory: AgentCore Memory resources and data")
print("  ğŸš€ Runtime: Agent runtime and ECR repository")
print("  ğŸ›¡ï¸ Security: Roles, and SSM secrets")
print("  ğŸ“Š Observability: CloudWatch logs")
print("  ğŸ“ Files: Local configuration files")
print()
print("âœ¨ Your AWS account is now clean and ready for new experiments!")
print("\nThank you for completing the AgentCore End-to-End tutorial! ğŸš€")
